One popular method is to install static pressure sensors at strategic points in the ductwork. These sensors can provide real-time readings of airflow velocity and pressure, allowing you to identify any issues or imbalances. Additionally, you can use flow meters to measure the volume of air flowing through the system, which can help you optimize system performance and efficiency. Another option is to use thermal imaging cameras to detect hot spots or leaks in the ductwork, which can indicate areas where airflow is being restricted. By regularly monitoring and maintaining your duct system, you can ensure that it operates at peak efficiency and provides optimal air quality for your home or business.
